verses.kjv: Thus hath the Lord GOD shewed unto me; and, behold, he formed grasshoppers in the beginning of the shooting up of the latter growth; and, lo, it was the latter growth after the king’s mowings.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD showed me: He was forming a swarm of locusts just as the late crops were beginning to sprout — the crops that grew after the king's share had been harvested.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that when they had made an end of eating the grass of the land, then I said, O Lord GOD, forgive, I beseech thee: by whom shall Jacob arise? for he is small.
verses.ct: When the locusts had finished devouring every plant in the land, I cried out, "Lord GOD, please forgive! How can Jacob survive? He is so small!"

verses.kjv: The LORD repented for this: It shall not be, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: The LORD relented about this. "It will not happen," the LORD said.

verses.kjv: Thus hath the Lord GOD shewed unto me: and, behold, the Lord GOD called to contend by fire, and it devoured the great deep, and did eat up a part.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD showed me: The Lord GOD was calling for judgment by fire. It consumed the vast underground waters and was devouring the farmland.

verses.kjv: Then said I, O Lord GOD, cease, I beseech thee: by whom shall Jacob arise? for he is small.
verses.ct: Then I cried out, "Lord GOD, please stop! How can Jacob survive? He is so small!"

verses.kjv: The LORD repented for this: This also shall not be, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.ct: The LORD relented about this too. "This will not happen either," the Lord GOD said.

verses.kjv: Thus he shewed me: and, behold, the LORD stood upon a wall made by a plumbline, with a plumbline in his hand.
verses.ct: This is what he showed me: The LORD was standing beside a wall built straight with a plumb line, holding a plumb line in his hand.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, Amos, what seest thou? And I said, A plumbline. Then said the LORD, Behold, I will set a plumbline in the midst of my people Israel: I will not again pass by them any more:
verses.ct: The LORD asked me, "Amos, what do you see?" I answered, "A plumb line." Then the LORD said, "Look, I am placing a plumb line among my people Israel. I will no longer spare them.

verses.kjv: And the high places of Isaac shall be desolate, and the sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste; and I will rise against the house of Jeroboam with the sword.
verses.ct: The hilltop shrines of Isaac will be destroyed, and the sanctuaries of Israel will be left in ruins. I will attack the dynasty of Jeroboam with the sword."

verses.kjv: Then Amaziah the priest of Bethel sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, Amos hath conspired against thee in the midst of the house of Israel: the land is not able to bear all his words.
verses.ct: Then Amaziah, the priest of Bethel, sent a message to King Jeroboam of Israel: "Amos has been plotting against you right here among the people of Israel. The country cannot endure everything he is saying.

verses.kjv: For thus Amos saith, Jeroboam shall die by the sword, and Israel shall surely be led away captive out of their own land.
verses.ct: This is what Amos is claiming: 'Jeroboam will die by the sword, and Israel will certainly be dragged away as captives from their own land.'"

verses.kjv: Also Amaziah said unto Amos, O thou seer, go, flee thee away into the land of Judah, and there eat bread, and prophesy there:
verses.ct: Then Amaziah told Amos, "You prophet, get out of here! Run back to the land of Judah. Earn your living and do your prophesying there.

verses.kjv: But prophesy not again any more at Bethel: for it is the king’s chapel, and it is the king’s court.
verses.ct: But don't ever prophesy at Bethel again, because this is the king's sanctuary and the royal residence."

verses.kjv: Then answered Amos, and said to Amaziah, I was no prophet, neither was I a prophet’s son; but I was an herdman, and a gatherer of sycomore fruit:
verses.ct: Amos replied to Amaziah, "I was not a prophet, and I was not trained as a prophet's apprentice. I was a herder and a tender of sycamore-fig trees.

verses.kjv: And the LORD took me as I followed the flock, and the LORD said unto me, Go, prophesy unto my people Israel.
verses.ct: But the LORD took me away from tending the flock, and the LORD told me, 'Go and prophesy to my people Israel.'

verses.kjv: Now therefore hear thou the word of the LORD: Thou sayest, Prophesy not against Israel, and drop not thy word against the house of Isaac.
verses.ct: So now listen to the word of the LORD. You are telling me, 'Don't prophesy against Israel, and stop preaching against the descendants of Isaac.'

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD; Thy wife shall be an harlot in the city, and thy sons and thy daughters shall fall by the sword, and thy land shall be divided by line; and thou shalt die in a polluted land: and Israel shall surely go into captivity forth of his land.
verses.ct: Because of that, this is what the LORD says: Your wife will become a prostitute in the city, and your sons and daughters will be killed by the sword. Your land will be measured out and divided among others. You yourself will die in a foreign, unclean land, and Israel will definitely be taken away as captives from their homeland."
